revised_title: Infectivity of Blood and Fluids in Septic Disease
tldr: The author investigates the infectivity of blood and other fluids in some forms of septic disease and the increase of virulence in successive inoculations. They found that in some cases, the blood of an animal intoxicated with putrid matter becomes infective and can reproduce symptoms in other animals. The author also discusses the work of previous researchers and their findings on the subject.
scientific_discipline: Medicine and Health Sciences > Infectious Diseases
